idpmanagement.addIdpSubheadline: Enter a name for the new Identity Provider to start the configuration
idpmanagement.updateIdpSubheadline: Configure your idp connection. Retrieve the metadata config file from your local idp and upload the same in the input field below. Additionally the client_id and secret are needed.
idpmanagement.updateIdpSubheadline2: to find a number of examples of local idp's such as Azure, Keycloak, etc.
idpmanagement.enableIdpSubheadline: This will open another option for people from your company to sign.
idpmanagement.enableIdpSuccessSubheadline: Go and test the login now
idpmanagement.disableIdpSubheadline: This will remove the option to sign in for people of your company
idpmanagement.description: Here you can manage how the users of your company authenticate with Catena-X. On registration we have created an IDP with one user entry for the admin (that's probably you ;). Many companies already have their own IDP where users authenticate using their known company user id and a familiar login mask. In this case you will probably prefer to use your own company IDP and you can create and manage the federation on this page.

idpdetail.title: Identity Provider Details
idpdetail.selectIpsText: Select the type of IdP which should get newly created
idpdetail.addMetaDataText: Add your metadata URL here, to automatically setup all the idp integration relevant metadata. When clicking, load. then metadata file is getting loaded and respective values will show up below.
idpdetail.idp_meta_description: Add your metadata URL here, to automatically setup all the idp integration relevant metadata. When clicking, Load then metadata file is getting loaded and respective values will show up below.

page.title: Identity Provider Config
page.desc: Here you can manage how the users of your company authenticate with Catena-X. On registration we have created an IDP with one user entry for the admin (that's probably you ;). Many companies already have their own IDP where users authenticate using their known company user id and a familiar login mask. In this case you will probably prefer to use your own company IDP and you can create and manage the federation on this page.

add.title: New IdP Connection
add.subtitle: Enter an IdP name and choose the type to start the configuration

edit.title: Edit Identity Provider Details
edit.subtitle: Configure the connection details to your company IdP

enable.title: Enable Identity Provider
enable.subtitle: This requires to link at least one user ID
enable.desc: Now link your existing user ID so you keep all permissions. Specify the user ID (not name) for your user at the new IdP.
enable.current: You are currently logged in as: {{ name }}
enable.label: Your User ID
enable.hint: Your existing user ID (not name) on target IDP

success.title: Identity Provider Enabled
success.subtitle: Your request has completed successfully
success.desc: Your new Identity Provider has been enabled and your user has been linked to it. Choose 'Sign out' and then log in again with the IDP named

disable.title: Disable Identity Provider
disable.subtitle: You are about to disable an Identity Provider
disable.desc: When you disable your Identity Provider you and other people of your company won't be able to login through this IDP.
disable.ask: Are you sure you want to proceed.

users.title: Link existing users to new IdP
users.subtitle: Make sure users can continue working
users.desc1: With the user migration function you can migrate/connect users created under the Keycloak shared IdP to your own IdP. This ensures that all user data and settings stay in place and assigned to the correct user.
users.desc2: Download the user list; enhance the csv file with the unique user id (available in your own idp) and upload the csv again. With the upload of the own idp user id; the existing user accounts will get linked to the own idp user account with the login of the user on the CX platform.
users.desc3: Specify their user ID (not name) at the new target IDP in the field 'UserId'

drop.intro: Upload mapped user list with ProviderUserID
drop.title: Drag & drop your files here
drop.subTitle: Or browse files on your computer
drop.note: only one CSV or JSON file allowed for upload

success.title: Request successful
success.subtitle: Your request to update the users has completed

display.name: Display name
display.hint: The name how this IdP is shown in the Central IdP selection (usually your company name)

alias.name: Alias
alias.hint: The IdP alias is a generated value and cannot be changed

type.name: Authentication type
type.hint: Select the authentication type of the new Identity Provider (currently only OIDC is supported)

redirectUri.name: Redirect URI
redirectUri.hint: Click to copy the shown URI and enter it as valid redirect URI for your IdP client

metadata.name: Metadata URI
metadata.hint: Enter the metadata URL from your IDP that ends with '/.well-known/openid-configuration'

clientId.name: Client ID
clientId.hint: Enter the client ID provided by your IdP

clientSecret.name: Client Secret
clientSecret.hint: Enter the client secret provided by your IdP

clientAuthMethod.name: Auth Method
clientAuthMethod.hint: The way how the central IdP authenticates with this IdP
